alert.note: Alert for Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 3:33AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SLIPPERY TRAVEL TODAY... This morning`s commute will feature some slippery surfaces, especially untreated roadways, sidewalks, and parking lots as refreezing of yesterday`s precipitation occurred in spots overnight. In addition there will be some light freezing drizzle falling on top through the early morning hours. As the morning progresses, light snow will begin to fall, possibly mixed with rain at lowest elevations. The rain is expected to turn to all snow as the afternoon progresses, likely leading to slippery conditions for the afternoon and evening commute where 1 to 3 inches of snow is expected, locally up to 4 inches at higher elevations by this evening. Motorists are advised to take it slow today and this evening.
